body_html:
I now tested with a toy-program that including only Arch Linux's unistd.h is (now, at least) of no problem for calls like read(int, char*, unsigned int). So, I have attempted a rebuild with upstream sources (until now I always patched the file beforehand, as a precautionary measure) and everything builds successfully.
The problem seems to be solved (and definitely never was on the PyTorch side). I don't know exactly why it happeded repeatedly at that time, but I believe this whole PR is no longer necessary.

Sorry for the noise.

body:
I now tested with a toy-program that including only Arch Linux's `unistd.h` is (now, at least) of no problem for calls like `read(int, char*, unsigned int)`. So, I have attempted a rebuild with upstream sources (until now I always patched the file beforehand, as a precautionary measure) and everything builds successfully. 
The problem seems to be solved (and definitely never was on the PyTorch side). I don't know exactly why it happeded repeatedly at that time, but I believe this whole PR is no longer necessary.

Sorry for the noise.
